body.p: In case of Comlth vs J W Perry -- in the Graves Equity & Criminal Court for Gaming a Judgment was rendered at the August term thereof 1860 for Two Hundred & Twenty five Dollars for suffering persons to play cards in his house -- Perry was a Tavern Keeper at since business is a poor man & I think the Gov would do a human act to release him

In case of Comlth vs Jas Gardner for betting on Presidential Election in 1856 a Judgment was rendered at August term 1857 for $100 -- Gov Morehead stopped its collection for one year he is poor & as all the others who were & fined for betting in 1856 were released I think that Gardner ought to be released as he is very poor & unable to pay his debts

In case of Comlth v S W Bennett on recognizance a Jugt was rendered by Lee Anderson for one Hundred Dollars as August term of Graves Equity & Criminal Court for 1860. I was not
in court when Judgt was rendered or I should have not been it -- The clerk &c. Court Anderson inform me that Bennet has been tried for the offence & fined & the debt before the Judgt on the recognizance these facts which I believe to be true the Gov is also to interpose
